JNImodule
Class jni::JavaEnv

QObject
   |
   +--jni::JavaEnv
   in javaenv.h
   in javaenv.cpp
class jni::JavaEnv
extends QObject

The JavaEnv class is a C++ wrapper around the Java environment (JNIEnv struct). The functions this class provides checks for illegal arguments, like NULL values. The original JNI does not do this, and as such errors could occur when providing the JNI with such arguments.

Parameters:
ret_type - the expected return type
c - the object to perform the method call on
method - the id of the method to invoke
args - the arguments to the method call
Returns:
a JNIValue with the result of the performed method call.

GetMethod

public JNIMethod* GetMethod( jclass c, const char* name, const char* signature );
Parameters:
c - the class the method is declared in
name - the name of the method
signature - the signature of the method This method is completely type-safe regarding input and output.
Returns:
a pointer to the JNIMethod object containing the method information of the requested method, or NULL if the method does not exist in the JVM.

GetMethodID

public jmethodID GetMethodID( JNIClass* c, const char* name, const char* signature );
Parameters:
c - the class in which the method is declared
name - the name of the method
signature - the signature of the method Use the GetStaticMethodID function for static methods, because they are handled in a different way in the JNI.
Returns:
the jmethodID object representing the method with the given requirements, or NULL is the method was not found.

GetStaticMethodID

public jmethodID GetStaticMethodID( JNIClass* c, const char* name, const char* signature );
Parameters:
c - the class in which the static method is declared
name - the name of the static method
signature - the signature of the static method Use the GetMethodID function for non-static methods, because they are handled in a different way in the JNI.
Returns:
the jmethodID object representing the static method with the given requirements, or NULL is the method was not found.

isAttached

public bool isAttached( QThread* thread );
Parameters:
thread - the QThread to check
Returns:
true if and only if the thread is still running and has a binding to a JNIEnv object, false otherwise.

IsRunning

public jboolean IsRunning();
Returns:
true if the JNI environment is running, false otherwise.
